document.masterDocTitle: New synonyms, combinations and status in the Chinese species of the family Meloidae Gyllenhal, 1810 (Coleoptera: Tenebrionoidea) with additional faunistic records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New synonyms, combinations and status in the Chinese species of the family Meloidae Gyllenhal, 1810 (Coleoptera: Tenebrionoidea) with additional faunistic records

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Epicauta emmerichi Pic, 1934: 86
.
Type locality: “Ginfushan” (= Mt. Jinfoshan , Chongqing , China )
. Type depository: NMPC, MNHN.

Denierella serrata Kaszab, 1952b: 88
.
Type locality: “Fukien, Kuatun” (= Guadun , Fujian , China )
.
Type depository: ZFMK , HNHM . Synonymized by
Batelka & Hájek 2015: 124
.

Epicauta apicipennis Tan, 1958: 163
. Type locality: “Omei-shan, Szechuan” (= Mt. Emeishan, Sichuan ), China . Type depository: IZCAS. Synonymized by
Kaszab 1960: 256
.

Epicauta rishwani Makhan, 2013: 1
.
Type locality: “ China , Beibei , Jinyun Mt. , Chongqing ”
. Type depository: cDM. syn. nov.

.

Distribution. China : Chongqing , Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi (new record), Hainan , Hubei , Hunan , Jiangxi , Sichuan , Zhejiang .

Remarks. Batelka & Hájek (2015) revised
Epicauta emmerichi
and designated its lectotype . In the collections of MNHN, one of us (Z. Pan) found four specimens labeled as the lectotype and paralectotypes designated by Batelka & Hájek (2015) . Meanwhile, another specimen with different labels was also found at MNHN, but labeled as “co-type”. So, we designated the mentioned five specimens as paralectotypes .

Batelka & Hájek (2015) , different form Bologna (2008) , considered
Epicauta apicipennis Tan, 1958
as a junior synonym of
D. emmerichi
according to the comments of Kaszab (1960) and Yang & Ren (2007a) . One of us (Z. Pan) examined one paratype of
E. apicipennis
at IZCAS and confirms the synonymy.

Makhan (2013) described
Epicauta rishwani
from Mt. Jinyunshan of Chongqing , China , with a brief description, but clear illustrations. The illustrations show that
E. rishwani
has the same features, e.g. the apex of elytra with gray setation, apical lobes of parameres very short in lateral view, and penis with large distal hook, as
D. emmerichi
. Meanwhile, D. Makhan (personal communication) confirmed that the ventral side of the claw dorsal blade has teeth. Consequently, we consider
E. rishwani
as a junior synonym of
D. emmerichi
.
